alert.note: Alert for Alleghany (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 4:17PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Alleghany County in west central Virginia and southeastern Greenbrier Counties in southeastern West Virginia through 445 PM EDT... At 417 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Alvon, or 7 miles southwest of Neola, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Neola... Alvon... Rorer... and Callaghan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
